channel.title: Screen problems with laptop, need advice
channel.description: Writing this with mobile. Basically, when I got home from school today, I turned on my laptop, note, i left it on, so the battery died, while i was at school. And yeah, nothing showed on the screen besides a very dim faded sort of bar code shape near the bottom of the monitor ? Although, it seems the computer is (kind of) fine, as i could still log on, and i heard the log on sound, but obviously couldn't see what i was doing, but yeah, screen's fucked... Any advice ? Laptop make: Fujitsu Siemens Amilo Li 2735, with windows 7 installed, fairly bottom range and crappy. :/ Thanks.

item.title: Screen problems with laptop, need advice
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Oh right, yeah, had no warranty anyway. :o

Read full topic
item.source: Screen problems with laptop, need advice

item.title: Screen problems with laptop, need advice
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

You voided your warranty when you took it apart.

Voiding your warranty means you just gave a giant middle finger to your warranty, and it isn’t active anymore.

Which it probably wasn’t anyways, because the factory warranties are usually a year long.

Read full topic

item.title: Screen problems with laptop, need advice
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:13, topic:329171”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=425550.msg3125441#msg3125441 date=1265992791]
ive taken like, all screws out, but where the heck are the cables connecting to the screen ?
[/quote]Void Warranty :)[/quote]

What’s that ?
It didn’t have any warrenty anyway, it’s over a year and a half old.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Shitttt, might just get a new laptop lool, kinda running out of hard drive space a lot anyway.[/quote]

Yeah, just get a new laptop. Sell the parts from your current one if there good enough. :]

item.description:

ive taken like, all screws out, but where the heck are the cables connecting to the screen ?

Errm. Here’s some pictures but I don’t know how well they will show up on your phone.

http://computershopper.com/laptops/howto/replace-your-laptop-screen

“The video cable is typically a long ribbon cable taped to the back of the screen.”
